channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Top 'Washington Post' editor kills article on deputy's departure
item.description: Washington Post Acting Executive Editor Matt Murray killed a story about the departure of a veteran and popular editor for a senior position at the New York Times.
item.content:encoded:
Washington Post Acting Executive Editor Matt Murray killed a story about the departure of a veteran and popular editor for a senior position at the New York Times.

(Image credit: Bill O'Leary)
item.dc:creator: David Folkenflik

item.title: Syrian Refugees Displaced for Years Return Home
item.description: The regime of President Bashar al-Assad crumbled in rapid fashion as rebel groups challenged his power. Assad is now in exile in Russia and the rebels have taken control of the capital, Damascus. Now displaced Syrians, some of whom have been out of the country for over a decade, are returning home. Our correspondent in Lebanon spoke to some returning Syrians.
item.content:encoded: The regime of President Bashar al-Assad crumbled in rapid fashion as rebel groups challenged his power. Assad is now in exile in Russia and the rebels have taken control of the capital, Damascus. Now displaced Syrians, some of whom have been out of the country for over a decade, are returning home. Our correspondent in Lebanon spoke to some returning Syrians.
item.dc:creator: Emily Feng

item.title: How will Australia's teen social media ban actually work?
item.description: Australia's Parliament has passed one of the strictest social media crackdowns in the world. Under the new law, anyone under 16 years old will be banned from opening a social media account.
item.content:encoded: Australia's Parliament has passed one of the strictest social media crackdowns in the world. Under the new law, anyone under 16 years old will be banned from opening a social media account.
item.dc:creator: Bobby Allyn

item.title: Soft medium, hard truths - National Endowment for the Arts recognizes a Navajo quilter
item.description: A Navajo woman who has spent 50 years sewing has now been honored with an NEA award for her unique quilts. She is unafraid to criticize the mainstream culture that's marginalized Indigenous artists.
item.content:encoded:
"Tears or our Children, Tears for our Children," as displayed at the National Museum of the American Indian'/>

A Navajo woman who has spent 50 years sewing has now been honored with an NEA award for her unique quilts. She is unafraid to criticize the mainstream culture that's marginalized Indigenous artists.

(Image credit: National Museum of the American Indian, Smithsonian Institution (26/9331). Photo by NMAI Photo Services)
item.dc:creator: Adam Burke

item.title: In Lebanon, villagers on the border watch Syria's revolution with unease
item.description: While Syrian refugees in Lebanon return home, many Lebanese remain on edge. Years of conflict have left the Syria-Lebanon borderlands scarred, and fears grow that instability could spill over again.
item.content:encoded:
While Syrian refugees in Lebanon return home, many Lebanese remain on edge. Years of conflict have left the Syria-Lebanon borderlands scarred, and fears grow that instability could spill over again.

(Image credit: Ayman Oghanna for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Ayman Oghanna

item.title: Bidders are back in court battling over the auction of Alex Jones' Infowars
item.description: A U.S. bankruptcy judge is hearing arguments for and against selling the show to The Onion, the satirical news site named the winning bidder. Host Alex Jones says the auction was rigged.
item.content:encoded:
A U.S. bankruptcy judge is hearing arguments for and against selling the show to The Onion, the satirical news site named the winning bidder. Host Alex Jones says the auction was rigged.

(Image credit: Joe Buglewicz)
item.dc:creator: Tovia Smith

item.title: United Healthcare shooting 'person of interest' Luigi Mangione arraigned in Pennsylvania
item.description: The 26-year-old man faces firearms and forgery charges in Pennsylvania. New York law enforcement are expected to submit their own charges related to the killing of United Healthcare CEO Brian Thompson.
item.content:encoded:
The 26-year-old man faces firearms and forgery charges in Pennsylvania. New York law enforcement are expected to submit their own charges related to the killing of United Healthcare CEO Brian Thompson.

(Image credit: Sydney Roach)
item.dc:creator: Alana Wise

item.title: Supreme Court rejects challenge to Boston's school admissions policy
item.description: The court's action was the second time the justices declined to intervene in an admissions program based on geography since their 2023 ruling invalidating affirmative action in higher education.
item.content:encoded:
The court's action was the second time the justices declined to intervene in an admissions program based on geography since their 2023 ruling invalidating affirmative action in higher education.

(Image credit: Anna Moneymaker)
item.dc:creator: Nina Totenberg

item.title: Supreme Court rejects challenge to Hawaii gun licensing rules -- for now
item.description: At issue was a Hawaii State Supreme Court decision that allowed the state to prosecute a man carrying a loaded pistol without a license.
item.content:encoded:
At issue was a Hawaii State Supreme Court decision that allowed the state to prosecute a man carrying a loaded pistol without a license.

(Image credit: Anna Moneymaker)
item.dc:creator: Nina Totenberg

item.title: The Eras era ends: A look back at Taylor Swift's record-breaking, 21-month tour
item.description: Swift has made over $2 billion in ticket sales and spent over 25 hours singing the 10-minute version of "All Too Well" since March 2023. Here's a look at the historic tour and what might come next.
item.content:encoded:
Swift has made over $2 billion in ticket sales and spent over 25 hours singing the 10-minute version of "All Too Well" since March 2023. Here's a look at the historic tour and what might come next.

(Image credit: Carlos Alvarez)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman
